entry.title: Artsakh families find refuge in Lori

media:group.media:title: Artsakh families find refuge in Lori
media:group.media:description:
More than 1,500 families (6000 individuals) from Artsakh have settled in the northern Armenian region of Lori. Most of the displaced families are starting new homes in the region‚Äôs capital Vanadzor. Data from the regional administration reveals that approximately 950 displaced children are attending schools, and over 4,000 individuals have registered in regional polyclinics. In Lorut Village, five families have secured shelter and are integrating in the village life.

entry.title: Armenia greenlights sale of country‚Äôs largest cellular company: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS

media:group.media:title: Armenia greenlights sale of country‚Äôs largest cellular company: THIS WEEK IN BUSINESS
media:group.media:description:
üìçArmenia approved the sale of the country‚Äôs largest mobile network operator to a Cyprus-based company with unnamed owners, just months after blocking such a move over national security concerns. üìçMore than a dozen IT companies that received roughly $475,000 in government benefits are now inactive, the Hetq investigative news site revealed. üìçArmenia has kept its position as one of Russia‚Äôs main sources of used cars, despite Georgia‚Äôs ban earlier this year on car re-exports through its territory.

entry.title: Shining a Light on Armenia's POWs in Baku

media:group.media:title: Shining a Light on Armenia's POWs in Baku
media:group.media:description:
This week on Insights, host Eric Hacopian discusses the urgent issue of Armenian prisoners of war still detained in Azerbaijan years after the November 9 ceasefire agreement. He also shared key statements from Artsakh's last president. Tune in for the latest information and perspectives on these critical topics.
